byline.contributor: Kristin Hussey reported from Newtown, and Lisa W. Foderaro from New York.
byline.original: By KRISTIN HUSSEY and LISA W. FODERARO

abstract: Officials in Newtown, Conn, unveil new Sandy Hook Elementary School, more than three years after gun massacre that killed 20 students and six teachers; design includes security features like bullet-resistant windows, and classrooms that can be locked from inside or out, allowing teachers to secure rooms without opening doors if intruders are present.

headline.print_headline: New Sandy Hook Elementary School Is Set to Open Nearly 4 Years After Massacre
headline.main: New Sandy Hook School Is Ready Nearly 4 Years After Massacre

snippet: At a preview of the building on Friday, there were mixed emotions: “You can’t be here at the opening of the school without thinking of the people we lost,” an education aide said....
lead_paragraph: At a preview of the building on Friday, there were mixed emotions: “You can’t be here at the opening of the school without thinking of the people we lost,” an education aide said.
